intro: Jasminoides, commonly known as the jasmine genus, is a group of flowering plants belonging to the Oleaceae family. These plants are characterized by their fragrant, small, white or yellow flowers that typically bloom in the evening. Jasminoides species are native to various regions across Asia, Africa, and Europe, and they thrive in warm, humid climates. The flowers are often used in perfumery and traditional medicine due to their aromatic properties. Many species within this genus are also cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and landscapes.
